TopicTitle: I downloaded Waterfall and WaterfallRestock. Something's not working correctly...

Articles.Content:
Okay, so I have Restock and wanted to add some cool exhaust effects. I heard about the Waterfall mod and tried downloading it, along with the WaterfallRestock mod. I opened up the downloaded folders, and each had a Gamedata folder within them. So I put the files called Gamedata into the KSP Gamedata folder. I open up the game and and I'm not presented with any errors or incompatability issues. I build a rocket with a Vector engine and fly it, only to discover that there aren't any effects added. As a matter of fact, there wasn't an exhaust plume to start with. 

I have the latest version of the base game (bought directly from the KSP website), Restock, and ModuleManager. I also have the latest version of Scatterer (although I don't think that really matters)

Is there something im missing, like an extra mod I need? Any and all help would be appreciated!

Edited October 17, 2022 by AstroSean
added detail

Can you post screenshots of your GameData folder and also engines in game with whatever plume effects (if any) you do have? It’ll also help if you can find your log files, put them on a file sharing site (preferably one without nasty malware popups) and post links to them, see this guide for details:

Check the Waterfall forum page and make sure you also downloaded any and all dependencies- if Waterfall relies on another mod to do something but you don’t have said other mod, Waterfall won’t work right/at all.

 

Final question- did you buy KSP on Steam, and if so did you put mods into the Steam copy of KSP? Steam has a habit of corrupting modded KSP so it’s always a good idea to make a new copy of KSP (just copy the whole Kerbal Space Program directory and paste it somewhere else e.g. your desktop) and then put mods into the new copy where Steam can’t meddle.
Alright I think I got it working now. Thanks!
Im pretty sure I had an outdated version of module manager and that was what was causing Waterfall not to work. Sorry for wasting any time…
